required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Utility and Validity of a High-intensity, Intermittent Exercise Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: The Utility and Validity of a High-intensity, Intermittent Exercise Protocol in Male Jumping Athletes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify an exercise-induced fatigue protocol to mimic central and peripheral acute fatigue effects associated with participation in vigorous dynamic sports activities and to understand the expected central (cardiovascular) and peripheral (muscular) impact of this protocol.

detailed_description.textblock: Fatigue-related parameters (BORG, heart rate, blood lactate level, concentric/eccentric force of the quadriceps muscle) will be measured before and after different short-term high-intensity, intermittent exercise protocols.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Each participant will randomly be assigned to two different fatigue protocols, on separate days. The first protocol is a high-intensity, intermittent exercise protocol and will be performed until complete exhaustion. The second protocol is a time-based variant of the previous protocol and will be performed during 5 minutes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameters will be continuously monitored 10 minutes before the start of the fatigue protocol until 30 minutes after completion of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate, expressed in beats per minute

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter will be monitored 10 minutes before the start of the fatigue protocol
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic dynamometry of the quadriceps muscle

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter will be monitored immediately after completion of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic dynamometry of the quadriceps muscle

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter will be monitored 15 minutes after completion of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic dynamometry of the quadriceps muscle

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameter will be monitored 30 minutes after completion of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic dynamometry of the quadriceps muscle

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameters will be monitored 10 minutes before the start of the fatigue protocol
primary_outcome.description: Blood lactate level, expressed in millimol per liter

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameters will be monitored 10 minutes after completion of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: Blood lactate level, expressed in millimol per liter

primary_outcome.time_frame: This parameters will be continuously monitored 10 minutes before the start of the fatigue protocol until 30 minutes after completion of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: BORG-score, indicating the rate of perceived exertion for legs and breathlessness

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time will be recorded immediately after completion of the fatigue protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Time to perform the fatigue protocol

intervention.description: During the fatigue protocol, participants will sprint forward 5 m, cut at a 90° angle, sprint forward another 5 m, and backpedal 5 m. This activity will be repeated 4 times before participants will complete a series of hurdle activities. First, they will perform 2-legged jumps over 5 hurdles that are 30 cm high, turn, and repeat the jumps. Second, they will perform side-stepping exercises over the 5 hurdles. Third, they will complete four 5-m lateral shuffles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men
- ≥ 18 years
- Volley- and basketball, non-elite
- ≥ 3 times per week sports participation
- No acute or overuse low back/lower extremity injuries in the past 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women
- <18 years
- >45 years
- other sports than volley- and basketball
- elite players
- <3 times per week sports participation
- acute or overuse low back/lower extremity injuries in the past 6 months
